title: Maxar unveils platform to speed up imagery access
summary: MGP platform is designed to simplify and speed up access to the Colorado company’s high-resolution Earth imagery.

title: House and Senate Appropriators Keep NASA Basically at FY2023 Levels
summary: House and Senate appropriators are moving forward with their FY2024 NASA funding bills. The Senate Appropriations committee approved the Commerce-Justice-Science bill today and the House will mark up their bill […]

title: NASA to Host Small Business Administration’s Annual Scorecard Event
summary: Media are invited to join NASA and Small Business Administration leadership at 9:30 a.m. EDT on Tuesday, July 18, at NASA Headquarters in Washington to highlight how federal agencies rank on meeting their small business goals.

title: NASA Awards Sounding Rocket Operations Follow-On Contract
summary: NASA has awarded the Sounding Rocket Operations IV (NSROC IV) contract to Peraton Inc. of Herndon, Virginia, to support suborbital flight operations managed by the agency’s Wallops Flight Facility in Virginia.

title: Elon Musk’s SpaceX nears $150 billion valuation after secondary share sale
summary: The valuation of Elon Musk’s SpaceX hit near $150 billion following a share sale by existing investors announced this week, CNBC has learned.

title: Vulcan’s upper stage failed due to higher stress and weaker welds
summary: CEO says the rocket could be certified for national security missions before mid-2024.

title: Centaur modifications push first Vulcan launch to fourth quarter
summary: United Launch Alliance is now planning a first launch of its Vulcan Centaur rocket in the fourth quarter after the company completes modifications to and testing of the upper stage.

title: Senate defense panel leaves National Security Space Launch unsecured
summary: Congress should listen to the Space Force and reject the Senate Armed Services Committee’s changes to the U.S. Space Force's National Security Space Launch procurement plans.

title: Chandrayaan-3 lunar landing mission poised for launch from India
summary: The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) Chandrayaan-3 lunar lander is set to launch from the Second Launch Pad at the Satish Dhawan Space Centre in Sriharikota, India. This will be India’s second attempt to successfully perform a lunar landing after the Chandrayaan-2 lander failed during its descent.

title: Investing in Space: Why Blue Origin’s engine explosion matters
summary: There’s a reason the saying “that’s why we test” exists. I’ve seen it a lot in my mentions the past few days. Unfortunately, and crucially, it ignores that tests happen for different reasons.
